DataElement.preferredName: Medical History Relevant Condition Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An identifiable class of injuries, disabilities, syndromes, or symptoms found in an individual's health background which is different from the one(s) previously specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:The relation of something to the matter at hand._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: The relation of something to the matter at hand._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: The relation of something to the matter at hand.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
